channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Corner of Croydon Road and Howard Road, SE20. Utility company have left barriers and Road sign behind after completion of works, 9th January
item.description:
Corner of Croydon Road and Howard Road, SE20. Utility company have left barriers and road sign behind after completion of works weeks ago. Left in the road and moved. Now causing an obstruction on footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Howard Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Behind Property on Granville Road, 9th January
item.description:
I reported this and it was closed as private property. How can this be when most of it is on the public highway. I will be contacting local MP about this. What's the point of paying council tax. Send an enforcement officer here to deal with this issue and get the landlord to clear it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Granville Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Overflowing bins along Old Dover Road/Blackheath Standard shops, 9th January
item.description:
Overflowing bins and awful litter on the road whole way along Blackheath Standard shops. Such a shame, shopkeepers say there is no road sweeping anymore and the litter is getting worse. I collect as much as I can but it's impossible to keep on top of, really needs some attention please!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Old Dover Road, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Knocked over posts, 9th January
item.description:
It seems someone had driven into the posts protecting the grass. Please arrange repair. Birchdene Drive, SE28. Been like this since 23rd December.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Birchdene Drive, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping - Thamesmead, Birchdene Drive, 9th January
item.description:
Please arrange for collection. These are all throughout Birchdene Drive, SE28. Although there is a fly-tipping warning sign, random items are still being dropped at side of the road. This is a continuous problem with fridges, TVs, furniture etc.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Birchdene Drive, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding on pavement and residential access is not possible, 9th January
item.description:
When there is heavy rain, the pavement and the entrance to our block of flats floods as is not passable. The drains on the pavement are blocked. This happens multiple times a year

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 151-155, Queen's Road, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Animal poop fouling and rubbish fly tipping, 9th January
item.description:
There is a gap right behind the electrical unit located on the frinstead road and that has been attracting dog poop and rubbish been thrown. This requires clearance and the gap to be covered to avoid any further misuse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highstead Crescent, North End, Greater London

item.title: La dolce cafe marchmont street, 9th January
item.description:
The cafe has blocked access to pavement for mobility users and buggies by blocking half pavement with a brown board and the other half by placing their board , no buggy , mobility scooter or any other similar cant access the public pavement and have to cross the road which is extremely unsafe
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Marchmont Street, St Pancras, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Fly-tipping, Thamesmead, 9th January
item.description:
Hi, Please arrange for collection. These are all throughout the alley/walkway between Floathaven Close and Silver Birch Close, towards Central Way bus stop X, SE28. I assume these are not reported during bin collections as these items have started accumulating over a couple of weeks. It is incredibly unsanitary as bags are being ripped through by foxes and the wind is distributing rubbish across the pavements. This is a continuous problem on the walkway.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Birchdene Drive, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet
